greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of Product_{k>=1} (1 - p(k)*x^k), where p(k) = number of partitions of k (A000041).
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Partition Function P
Index entries for sequences related to partitions
mathematica: nmax = 43; CoefficientList[Series[Product[(1 - PartitionsP[k] x^k), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x]
a[n_] := a[n] = If[n == 0, 1, Sum[-Sum[d PartitionsP[d]^(k/d), {d, Divisors[k]}] a[n - k], {k, 1, n}]/n]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 43}]
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, May 18 2018
